intro: Wikstroemia gaomushanensis, commonly known as the Gaomushan Wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its botanical features include narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
